result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul Martin Allen III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Paul Martin Allen III is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Paul Martin Allen III was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge R. Michael Waterman July 10, 2017 - add condition time.

Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to report to Probation Monday April 13, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to probation.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation but must petition the Court.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.`
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF203.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF203.

-Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow through with any recommendations.
-Remain fully employed or full-time schooling.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-No Contact whatsoever with Mackenzie Gerard.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-If requested by Victim or Victim's family, must participate in Victim Impact Panel through Restorative Justice Program
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Count 2 - dismissed.

Court costs converted to a civil judgment.

Huber granted for work, to seek work and any AODA treatment.

Huber will need to be approved by Huber Officer.

- Any outstanding Court obligations be reduced to a civil judgment.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF203,14CF399 and 14CF448:
  CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Liddle ,ADA: Kevin Gehler   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Paul Martin Allen appeared. Case called at 4:14 p.m.      Defendant is fine with Judge Lundell hearing case and so is parent and attorney. ADA Gehler gives recommendations. Victim is not present but has been notified and Victim Statement completed. Eligible for expungment upon successful completion of probation.  Atty Perrin in agreement with the recommendations. Court reads charge and maximum penalties and rights. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 14CF203 . DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 amended to Misd. Battery in 14CF448.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF203. Finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Misd. Battery in 14CF448. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF203, both counts in 14CF399 and dismisses counts 2-6 in 14CF448 . Jessica from Victim Witness recites Victim's Impact Statement. Statement read by victim's father. ADA Gehler makes statement. Atty Perrin makes statement. Court recesses at 5:00 p.m. Case recalled at 5:02 p.m. 
Crt orders:
14CF203-Count 1-Possess with Intent and 14CF448 Ct 1 amended charge of Misd. Battery
- S/W 2years probation concurrent with 14CF203. Sign up for probation Monday April 13, 2015. Bond continues until reports to probation
- Domestic Abuse assessment and follow through with any recommendations
- Restitution in the amount of $599.68. Can set up payment plan
- Court costs total $443 for 14CF448 and 14CF203 $518.00. Can set up payment plan
- Remain fully employed or full time schooling
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mackenzie Gerard.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.
- Obtain GED or HSED
- Ordered to complete an alcohol assessment
- Can apply for expungment upon successful completion of probation
- If requested by Victim or Victim's family, must complete Victim Impact Panel through Restorative Justice Program
Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Filed by Atty Perrin. Requesting a continuance. km
Plea hearing on April 10, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Plea hearing on April 1, 2015 at 04:15 pm.
Plea hearing on March 31, 2015 at 04:15 pm.
